00049 
00050 enum {
00051         INTERVAL_RED = 0,
00052         INTERVAL_BLACK = 1
00053 };
00054 
00055 static inline int node_is_left_child(struct interval_node *node)
00056 {
00057         LASSERT(node->in_parent != NULL);
00058         return node == node->in_parent->in_left;
00059 }
00060 
00061 static inline int node_is_right_child(struct interval_node *node)
00062 {
00063         LASSERT(node->in_parent != NULL);
00064         return node == node->in_parent->in_right;
00065 }
00066 
00067 static inline int node_is_red(struct interval_node *node)
00068 {
00069         return node->in_color == INTERVAL_RED;
00070 }
00071 
00072 static inline int node_is_black(struct interval_node *node)
00073 {
00074         return node->in_color == INTERVAL_BLACK;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline int extent_compare(struct interval_node_extent *e1,
00078                                  struct interval_node_extent *e2)
00079 {
00080         int rc;
00081         if (e1->start == e2->start) {
00082                 if (e1->end < e2->end)
00083                         rc = -1;
00084                 else if (e1->end > e2->end)
00085                         rc = 1;
00086                 else
00087                         rc = 0;
00088         } else {
00089                 if (e1->start < e2->start)
00090                         rc = -1;
00091                 else
00092                         rc = 1;
00093         }
00094         return rc;
00095 }
00096 
00097 static inline int extent_equal(struct interval_node_extent *e1,
00098                                struct interval_node_extent *e2)
00099 {
00100         return (e1->start == e2->start) && (e1->end == e2->end);
00101 }
00102 
00103 static inline int extent_overlapped(struct interval_node_extent *e1,
00104                                     struct interval_node_extent *e2)
00105 {
00106         return (e1->start <= e2->end) && (e2->start <= e1->end);
00107 }
00108 
00109 static inline int node_compare(struct interval_node *n1,
00110                                struct interval_node *n2)
00111 {
00112         return extent_compare(&n1->in_extent, &n2->in_extent);
00113 }
00114 
00115 int node_equal(struct interval_node *n1, struct interval_node *n2)
00116 {
00117         return extent_equal(&n1->in_extent, &n2->in_extent);
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline __u64 max_u64(__u64 x, __u64 y)
00121 {
00122         return x > y ? x : y;
00123 }
00124 
00125 static inline __u64 min_u64(__u64 x, __u64 y)
00126 {
00127         return x < y ? x : y;
00128 }
00129 
00130 #define interval_for_each(node, root)                   \
00131 for (node = interval_first(root); node != NULL;         \
00132      node = interval_next(node))
00133 
00134 #define interval_for_each_reverse(node, root)           \
00135 for (node = interval_last(root); node != NULL;          \
00136      node = interval_prev(node))
00137 
00138 static struct interval_node *interval_first(struct interval_node *node)
00139 {
00140         ENTRY;
00141 
00142         if (!node)
00143                 RETURN(NULL);
00144         while (node->in_left)
00145                 node = node->in_left;
00146         RETURN(node);
00147 }
00148 
00149 static struct interval_node *interval_last(struct interval_node *node)
00150 {
00151         ENTRY;
00152 
00153         if (!node)
00154                 RETURN(NULL);
00155         while (node->in_right)
00156                 node = node->in_right;
00157         RETURN(node);
00158 }
00159 
00160 static struct interval_node *interval_next(struct interval_node *node)
00161 {
00162         ENTRY;
00163 
00164         if (!node)
00165                 RETURN(NULL);
00166         if (node->in_right)
00167                 RETURN(interval_first(node->in_right));
00168         while (node->in_parent && node_is_right_child(node))
00169                 node = node->in_parent;
00170         RETURN(node->in_parent);
00171 }
00172 
00173 static struct interval_node *interval_prev(struct interval_node *node)
00174 {
00175         ENTRY;
00176 
00177         if (!node)
00178                 RETURN(NULL);
00179 
00180         if (node->in_left)
00181                 RETURN(interval_last(node->in_left));
00182 
00183         while (node->in_parent && node_is_left_child(node))
00184                 node = node->in_parent;
00185 
00186         RETURN(node->in_parent);
00187 }
00188 
00189 enum interval_iter interval_iterate(struct interval_node *root,
00190                                     interval_callback_t func,
00191                                     void *data)
00192 {
00193         struct interval_node *node;
00194         enum interval_iter rc = INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00195         ENTRY;
00196         
00197         interval_for_each(node, root) {
00198                 rc = func(node, data);
00199                 if (rc == INTERVAL_ITER_STOP)
00200                         break;
00201         }
00202 
00203         RETURN(rc);
00204 }
00205 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_iterate);
00206 
00207 enum interval_iter interval_iterate_reverse(struct interval_node *root,
00208                                             interval_callback_t func,
00209                                             void *data)
00210 {
00211         struct interval_node *node;
00212         enum interval_iter rc = INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00213         ENTRY;
00214         
00215         interval_for_each_reverse(node, root) {
00216                 rc = func(node, data);
00217                 if (rc == INTERVAL_ITER_STOP)
00218                         break;
00219         }
00220 
00221         RETURN(rc);
00222 }
00223 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_iterate_reverse);
00224 
00225 /* try to find a node with same interval in the tree,
00226  * if found, return the pointer to the node, otherwise return NULL*/
00227 struct interval_node *interval_find(struct interval_node *root,
00228                                     struct interval_node_extent *ex)
00229 {
00230         struct interval_node *walk = root;
00231         int rc;
00232         ENTRY;
00233 
00234         while (walk) {
00235                 rc = extent_compare(ex, &walk->in_extent);
00236                 if (rc == 0)
00237                         break;
00238                 else if (rc < 0)
00239                         walk = walk->in_left;
00240                 else
00241                         walk = walk->in_right;
00242         }
00243 
00244         RETURN(walk);
00245 }
00246 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_find);
00247 
00248 static void __rotate_change_maxhigh(struct interval_node *node,
00249                                     struct interval_node *rotate)
00250 {
00251         __u64 left_max, right_max;
00252 
00253         rotate->in_max_high = node->in_max_high;
00254         left_max = node->in_left ? node->in_left->in_max_high : 0;
00255         right_max = node->in_right ? node->in_right->in_max_high : 0;
00256         node->in_max_high  = max_u64(interval_high(node),
00257                                      max_u64(left_max,right_max));
00258 }
00259 
00260 /* The left rotation "pivots" around the link from node to node->right, and
00261  * - node will be linked to node->right's left child, and
00262  * - node->right's left child will be linked to node's right child.  */
00263 static void __rotate_left(struct interval_node *node,
00264                           struct interval_node **root)
00265 {
00266         struct interval_node *right = node->in_right;
00267         struct interval_node *parent = node->in_parent;
00268 
00269         node->in_right = right->in_left;
00270         if (node->in_right)
00271                 right->in_left->in_parent = node;
00272 
00273         right->in_left = node;
00274         right->in_parent = parent;
00275         if (parent) {
00276                 if (node_is_left_child(node))
00277                         parent->in_left = right;
00278                 else
00279                         parent->in_right = right;
00280         } else {
00281                 *root = right;
00282         }
00283         node->in_parent = right;
00284 
00285         /* update max_high for node and right */
00286         __rotate_change_maxhigh(node, right);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /* The right rotation "pivots" around the link from node to node->left, and
00290  * - node will be linked to node->left's right child, and
00291  * - node->left's right child will be linked to node's left child.  */
00292 static void __rotate_right(struct interval_node *node,
00293                            struct interval_node **root)
00294 {
00295         struct interval_node *left = node->in_left;
00296         struct interval_node *parent = node->in_parent;
00297 
00298         node->in_left = left->in_right;
00299         if (node->in_left)
00300                 left->in_right->in_parent = node;
00301         left->in_right = node;
00302 
00303         left->in_parent = parent;
00304         if (parent) {
00305                 if (node_is_right_child(node))
00306                         parent->in_right = left;
00307                 else
00308                         parent->in_left = left;
00309         } else {
00310                 *root = left;
00311         }
00312         node->in_parent = left;
00313 
00314         /* update max_high for node and left */
00315         __rotate_change_maxhigh(node, left);
00316 }
00317 
00318 #define interval_swap(a, b) do {                        \
00319         struct interval_node *c = a; a = b; b = c;      \
00320 } while (0)
00321 
00322 /*
00323  * Operations INSERT and DELETE, when run on a tree with n keys, 
00324  * take O(logN) time.Because they modify the tree, the result 
00325  * may violate the red-black properties.To restore these properties, 
00326  * we must change the colors of some of the nodes in the tree 
00327  * and also change the pointer structure.
00328  */
00329 static void interval_insert_color(struct interval_node *node,
00330                                   struct interval_node **root)
00331 {
00332         struct interval_node *parent, *gparent;
00333         ENTRY;
00334 
00335         while ((parent = node->in_parent) && node_is_red(parent)) {
00336                 gparent = parent->in_parent;
00337                 /* Parent is RED, so gparent must not be NULL */
00338                 if (node_is_left_child(parent)) {
00339                         struct interval_node *uncle;
00340                         uncle = gparent->in_right;
00341                         if (uncle && node_is_red(uncle)) {
00342                                 uncle->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00343                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00344                                 gparent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00345                                 node = gparent;
00346                                 continue;
00347                         }
00348 
00349                         if (parent->in_right == node) {
00350                                 __rotate_left(parent, root);
00351                                 interval_swap(node, parent);
00352                         }
00353 
00354                         parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00355                         gparent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00356                         __rotate_right(gparent, root);
00357                 } else {
00358                         struct interval_node *uncle;
00359                         uncle = gparent->in_left;
00360                         if (uncle && node_is_red(uncle)) {
00361                                 uncle->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00362                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00363                                 gparent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00364                                 node = gparent;
00365                                 continue;
00366                         }
00367 
00368                         if (node_is_left_child(node)) {
00369                                 __rotate_right(parent, root);
00370                                 interval_swap(node, parent);
00371                         }
00372 
00373                         parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00374                         gparent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00375                         __rotate_left(gparent, root);
00376                 }
00377         }
00378 
00379         (*root)->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00380         EXIT;
00381 }
00382 
00383 struct interval_node *interval_insert(struct interval_node *node,
00384                                       struct interval_node **root)
00385                      
00386 {
00387         struct interval_node **p, *parent = NULL;
00388         ENTRY;
00389 
00390         LASSERT(!interval_is_intree(node));
00391         p = root;
00392         while (*p) {
00393                 parent = *p;
00394                 if (node_equal(parent, node))
00395                         RETURN(parent);
00396 
00397                 /* max_high field must be updated after each iteration */
00398                 if (parent->in_max_high < interval_high(node))
00399                         parent->in_max_high = interval_high(node);
00400 
00401                 if (node_compare(node, parent) < 0)
00402                         p = &parent->in_left;
00403                 else 
00404                         p = &parent->in_right;
00405         }
00406 
00407         /* link node into the tree */
00408         node->in_parent = parent;
00409         node->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00410         node->in_left = node->in_right = NULL;
00411         *p = node;
00412 
00413         interval_insert_color(node, root);
00414         node->in_intree = 1;
00415 
00416         RETURN(NULL);
00417 }
00418 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_insert);
00419 
00420 static inline int node_is_black_or_0(struct interval_node *node)
00421 {
00422         return !node || node_is_black(node);
00423 }
00424 
00425 static void interval_erase_color(struct interval_node *node,
00426                                  struct interval_node *parent,
00427                                  struct interval_node **root)
00428 {
00429         struct interval_node *tmp;
00430         ENTRY;
00431 
00432         while (node_is_black_or_0(node) && node != *root) {
00433                 if (parent->in_left == node) {
00434                         tmp = parent->in_right;
00435                         if (node_is_red(tmp)) {
00436                                 tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00437                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00438                                 __rotate_left(parent, root);
00439                                 tmp = parent->in_right;
00440                         }
00441                         if (node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_left) &&
00442                             node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_right)) {
00443                                 tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00444                                 node = parent;
00445                                 parent = node->in_parent;
00446                         } else {
00447                                 if (node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_right)) {
00448                                         struct interval_node *o_left;
00449                                         if ((o_left = tmp->in_left))
00450                                              o_left->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00451                                         tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00452                                         __rotate_right(tmp, root);
00453                                         tmp = parent->in_right;
00454                                 }
00455                                 tmp->in_color = parent->in_color;
00456                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00457                                 if (tmp->in_right)
00458                                     tmp->in_right->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00459                                 __rotate_left(parent, root);
00460                                 node = *root;
00461                                 break;
00462                         }
00463                 } else {
00464                         tmp = parent->in_left;
00465                         if (node_is_red(tmp)) {
00466                                 tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00467                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00468                                 __rotate_right(parent, root);
00469                                 tmp = parent->in_left;
00470                         }
00471                         if (node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_left) &&
00472                             node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_right)) {
00473                                 tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00474                                 node = parent;
00475                                 parent = node->in_parent;
00476                         } else {
00477                                 if (node_is_black_or_0(tmp->in_left)) {
00478                                         struct interval_node *o_right;
00479                                         if ((o_right = tmp->in_right))
00480                                             o_right->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00481                                         tmp->in_color = INTERVAL_RED;
00482                                         __rotate_left(tmp, root);
00483                                         tmp = parent->in_left;
00484                                 }
00485                                 tmp->in_color = parent->in_color;
00486                                 parent->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00487                                 if (tmp->in_left)
00488                                         tmp->in_left->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00489                                 __rotate_right(parent, root);
00490                                 node = *root;
00491                                 break;
00492                         }
00493                 }
00494         }
00495         if (node)
00496                 node->in_color = INTERVAL_BLACK;
00497         EXIT;
00498 }
00499 
00500 /* 
00501  * if the @max_high value of @node is changed, this function traverse  a path 
00502  * from node  up to the root to update max_high for the whole tree.
00503  */
00504 static void update_maxhigh(struct interval_node *node,
00505                            __u64  old_maxhigh)
00506 {
00507         __u64 left_max, right_max;
00508         ENTRY;
00509 
00510         while (node) {
00511                 left_max = node->in_left ? node->in_left->in_max_high : 0;
00512                 right_max = node->in_right ? node->in_right->in_max_high : 0;
00513                 node->in_max_high = max_u64(interval_high(node),
00514                                             max_u64(left_max, right_max));
00515 
00516                 if (node->in_max_high >= old_maxhigh)
00517                         break;
00518                 node = node->in_parent;
00519         }
00520         EXIT;
00521 }
00522 
00523 void interval_erase(struct interval_node *node,
00524                     struct interval_node **root)
00525 {
00526         struct interval_node *child, *parent;
00527         int color;
00528         ENTRY;
00529 
00530         LASSERT(interval_is_intree(node));
00531         node->in_intree = 0;
00532         if (!node->in_left) {
00533                 child = node->in_right;
00534         } else if (!node->in_right) {
00535                 child = node->in_left;
00536         } else { /* Both left and right child are not NULL */
00537                 struct interval_node *old = node;
00538 
00539                 node = interval_next(node);
00540                 child = node->in_right;
00541                 parent = node->in_parent;
00542                 color = node->in_color;
00543 
00544                 if (child)
00545                         child->in_parent = parent;
00546                 if (parent == old)
00547                         parent->in_right = child;
00548                 else
00549                         parent->in_left = child;
00550 
00551                 node->in_color = old->in_color;
00552                 node->in_right = old->in_right;
00553                 node->in_left = old->in_left;
00554                 node->in_parent = old->in_parent;
00555 
00556                 if (old->in_parent) {
00557                         if (node_is_left_child(old))
00558                                 old->in_parent->in_left = node;
00559                         else
00560                                 old->in_parent->in_right = node;
00561                 } else {
00562                         *root = node;
00563                 }
00564 
00565                 old->in_left->in_parent = node;
00566                 if (old->in_right)
00567                         old->in_right->in_parent = node;
00568                 update_maxhigh(child ? : parent, node->in_max_high);
00569                 update_maxhigh(node, old->in_max_high);
00570                 if (parent == old)
00571                          parent = node;
00572                 goto color;
00573         }
00574         parent = node->in_parent;
00575         color = node->in_color;
00576 
00577         if (child)
00578                 child->in_parent = parent;
00579         if (parent) {
00580                 if (node_is_left_child(node))
00581                         parent->in_left = child;
00582                 else
00583                         parent->in_right = child;
00584         } else {
00585                 *root = child;
00586         }
00587 
00588         update_maxhigh(child ? : parent, node->in_max_high);
00589 
00590 color:
00591         if (color == INTERVAL_BLACK)
00592                 interval_erase_color(child, parent, root);
00593         EXIT;
00594 }
00595 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_erase);
00596 
00597 static inline int interval_may_overlap(struct interval_node *node,
00598                                           struct interval_node_extent *ext)
00599 {
00600         return (ext->start <= node->in_max_high &&
00601                 ext->end >= interval_low(node));
00602 }
00603 
00604 /*
00605  * This function finds all intervals that overlap interval ext,
00606  * and calls func to handle resulted intervals one by one.
00607  * in lustre, this function will find all conflicting locks in
00608  * the granted queue and add these locks to the ast work list.
00609  *
00610  * {
00611  *       if (node == NULL)
00612  *               return 0;
00613  *       if (ext->end < interval_low(node)) {
00614  *               interval_search(node->in_left, ext, func, data);
00615  *       } else if (interval_may_overlap(node, ext)) {
00616  *               if (extent_overlapped(ext, &node->in_extent))
00617  *                       func(node, data);
00618  *               interval_search(node->in_left, ext, func, data);
00619  *               interval_search(node->in_right, ext, func, data);
00620  *       }
00621  *       return 0;
00622  * }
00623  *
00624  */
00625 enum interval_iter interval_search(struct interval_node *node,
00626                                    struct interval_node_extent *ext,
00627                                    interval_callback_t func,
00628                                    void *data)
00629 {
00630         struct interval_node *parent;
00631         enum interval_iter rc = INTERVAL_ITER_CONT;
00632 
00633         ENTRY;
00634 
00635         LASSERT(ext != NULL);
00636         LASSERT(func != NULL);
00637 
00638         while (node) {
00639                 if (ext->end < interval_low(node)) {
00640                         if (node->in_left) {
00641                                 node = node->in_left;
00642                                 continue;
00643                         }
00644                 } else if (interval_may_overlap(node, ext)) {
00645                         if (extent_overlapped(ext, &node->in_extent)) {
00646                                 rc = func(node, data);
00647                                 if (rc == INTERVAL_ITER_STOP)
00648                                         break;
00649                         }
00650 
00651                         if (node->in_left) {
00652                                 node = node->in_left;
00653                                 continue;
00654                         }
00655                         if (node->in_right) {
00656                                 node = node->in_right;
00657                                 continue;
00658                         }
00659                 }
00660 
00661                 parent = node->in_parent;
00662                 while (parent) {
00663                         if (node_is_left_child(node) &&
00664                             parent->in_right) {
00665                                 /* If we ever got the left, it means that the
00666                                  * parent met ext->end<interval_low(parent), or
00667                                  * may_overlap(parent). If the former is true,
00668                                  * we needn't go back. So stop early and check
00669                                  * may_overlap(parent) after this loop.  */
00670                                 node = parent->in_right;
00671                                 break;
00672                         }
00673                         node = parent;
00674                         parent = parent->in_parent;
00675                 }
00676                 if (parent == NULL || !interval_may_overlap(parent, ext))
00677                         break;
00678         }
00679 
00680         RETURN(rc);
00681 }
00682 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_search);
00683 
00684 static enum interval_iter interval_overlap_cb(struct interval_node *n,
00685                                               void *args)
00686 {
00687         *(int *)args = 1;
00688         return INTERVAL_ITER_STOP;
00689 }
00690 
00691 int interval_is_overlapped(struct interval_node *root,
00692                            struct interval_node_extent *ext)
00693 {
00694         int has = 0;
00695         (void)interval_search(root, ext, interval_overlap_cb, &has);
00696         return has;
00697 }
00698 EXPORT_SYMBOL(interval_is_overlapped);
00699 
00700 /* Don't expand to low. Expanding downwards is expensive, and meaningless to
00701  * some extents, because programs seldom do IO backward.
00702  *
00703  * The recursive algorithm of expanding low:
00704  * expand_low {
00705  *        struct interval_node *tmp;
00706  *        static __u64 res = 0;
00707  *
00708  *        if (root == NULL)
00709  *                return res;
00710  *        if (root->in_max_high < low) {
00711  *                res = max_u64(root->in_max_high + 1, res);
00712  *                return res;
00713  *        } else if (low < interval_low(root)) {
00714  *                interval_expand_low(root->in_left, low);
00715  *                return res;
00716  *        }
00717  *
00718  *        if (interval_high(root) < low)
00719  *                res = max_u64(interval_high(root) + 1, res);
00720  *        interval_expand_low(root->in_left, low);
00721  *        interval_expand_low(root->in_right, low);
00722  *
00723  *        return res;
00724  * }
00725  *
00726  * It's much easy to eliminate the recursion, see interval_search for 
00727  * an example. -jay
00728  */
00729 static inline __u64 interval_expand_low(struct interval_node *root, __u64 low)
00730 {
00731         /* we only concern the empty tree right now. */
00732         if (root == NULL)
00733                 return 0;
00734         return low;
00735 }
00736 
00737 static inline __u64 interval_expand_high(struct interval_node *node, __u64 high)
00738 {
00739         __u64 result = ~0;
00740 
00741         while (node != NULL) {
00742                 if (node->in_max_high < high)
00743                         break;
00744                         
00745                 if (interval_low(node) > high) {
00746                         result = interval_low(node) - 1;
00747                         node = node->in_left;
00748                 } else {
00749                         node = node->in_right;
00750                 }
00751         }
00752 
00753         return result;
00754 }
00755 
00756 /* expanding the extent based on @ext. */
00757 void interval_expand(struct interval_node *root,
00758                      struct interval_node_extent *ext,
00759                      struct interval_node_extent *limiter)
00760 {
00761         /* The assertion of interval_is_overlapped is expensive because we may
00762          * travel many nodes to find the overlapped node. */
00763         LASSERT(interval_is_overlapped(root, ext) == 0);
00764         if (!limiter || limiter->start < ext->start)
00765                 ext->start = interval_expand_low(root, ext->start);
00766         if (!limiter || limiter->end > ext->end)
00767                 ext->end = interval_expand_high(root, ext->end);
00768         LASSERT(interval_is_overlapped(root, ext) == 0);
00769 }
